messageBody:
On 2002-07-02 at 12:25 Daniel Barclay wrote:

>> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@...]
>>
>> This is a design smell: static initializers make diagnosing problems
>> difficult, because they general require JVM shutdown and restart to
>> reproduce.
>
>Unless you're using class loaders, right?

I prefer not to use class loaders, where possible. I consider it an
annoyance. That's just my opinion. If I feel the need to use class
loaders to write a test case, I wonder whether I can rewrite the test
case not to need them.
